sentence.Network_en: The number of deaths makes the story newsworthy.
sentence.Network_cn: 死亡人数使这篇报道具有了新闻价值。

sentence.Network_en: This situation might develop into an even more newsworthy item if the police were involved.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果警方涉入的话，这个局面就会变得更有新闻价值了。

sentence.Network_en: It is this which makes chemical accidents so newsworthy . Fortunately, they are extremely rare.
sentence.Network_cn: 这就是化工事故如此有新闻价值的原因, 但幸运的是这种事故极少发生.

entry.tran: 有报道价值的;有新闻价值的;值得报道的
entry.def: An event, fact, or person that is newsworthy is considered to be interesting enough to be reported in newspapers or on the radio or television.

example.ex: The number of deaths makes the story newsworthy...
example.tran: 死亡人数使这篇报道具有了新闻价值。

example.ex: This situation might develop into an even more newsworthy item if the police were involved.
example.tran: 如果警方涉入的话，这个局面就会变得更有新闻价值了。

means.word_mean: 1. sufficiently interesting to be reported in a newspaper

auth_sentence.content: This isn't particularly newsworthy, he says.
